channel.title: Nervous on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Nervous on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Forming form guidelines
item.description: Who knew web design could be so… academic? Since I got back from @media I’ve been hard at work on a set of guidelines which ideally will one day guide the interaction and styling of all forms on the myriad of BCIT web applications though right now will only be applied to anything in the ‘public web’ look and feel.Â I don’t think I’ve done this much research since I finished university.

item.title: Styling Our Style Sheets
item.description: I’ve been wanting to seriously redo some of the HTML and CSS behind the BCIT site since I came on board here almost a year ago. Well, I get my wish. We’re going to take some baby steps towards semantic HTML and CSS (POSH if you like) and despite my aversion to being in charge, I’m leading the project. As a first step I’m trying to write a CSS coding style guide.

item.title: I'm presenting at a conference!
item.description: One of the projects I’ve worked on at BCIT is Catt-Trax2. The website is for Danny Catt who is traveling through South America and Antarctica exploring conservation and sustainability issues and talking to the people in those regions working with those issues daily. He’s taking photos, video, and sound clips of this journey and blogging about his experiences. I helped architect the website and did some design and implementation work on it.
